result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark A Brassington was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Payment plan of $100.00/ month commencing on 11-6-2015 and continuing to be due on the 6th of every month until paid in full. Payments payable to Ozaukee County Clerk of Courts.
Failure to pay will result in 1 day jail for every $25.00 outstanding.

Anger Management and any follow up deemed appropriate by the department. 
A Parenting counseling course determined by the department.
No contact with the 9 year old victim unless agreed upon by the department and with conditions.
Supervision maybe transfered to the county residing in.
Submit to DNA sample by 10-30-2015, at the Ozaukee County Jail.

Defendant Mark A Brassington in court with attorney Robert P Olmr.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court sets restitution to zero.
Sentencing hearing at 10-07-2015 01:15 pm

Defendant Mark A Brassington in court with attorney Robert P Olmr.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea questionnaire filed.  State requesting adj of sentencing.  State moves to amend orally to two counts of disorderly conduct and will file an amended information later today.  State's recommendation not placed on the record.  Court examines defendant.  Defendant changes plea to no contest on both counts.  Court accepts change of plea & finds defendant guilty.  Court orders matter adj for sentencing.  Counsel requesting modification of the no contact order.  State objects, requesting hearing in order to discuss with victim.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
